column4: I got 1000 files without an extension, I need to add ,fcm to the end of each file, any quick way to do this other than manually
do you know regular expressions?  If so, you can use the 'rename' command.  A for loop would work too in that case
wait, did you mean file or file name?
yes, try: rename -n 's/$/.fcm/' *       if that looks right, get rid of the -n
thnx it looks good,, what does excluding the -n switch do ?
the -n makes it tell you what it will do without doing it.  Without the -n, it will actually do what it said
apply the patch (see 'man patch') before you do dpkg-buildpackage.  You probably also want to run 'dch -i' and append ~tatters to the version.
why did u direct me to a link for apt-get, do we use that to apply a patch?
well without more context, I'm assuming you need to rebuild a package to apply the patch
I assumed a patch could be applied to a script without rebuilding?
